newsitem.title: USA: CBOE, PHLX and PSE set new options listings.
newsitem.headline: CBOE, PHLX and PSE set new options listings.

text.p: The Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE), Philadelphia Stock Exchange (PHLX) and Pacific Stock Exchange (PSE) said Thursday they set new options listings for next week.
The CBOE said it would list LEAPS (long term equity anticipation securities) on Andrew Corp on March 17.
The LEAPS would have strike prices of 35, 40 and 45, with expirations in January 1998 and January 1999, it said.
The PHLX said it would begin trading options on shares of Natural MicroSystems Corp and Plasma & Materials Technologies Inc on March 18.
Natural MicroSytems options would open with strike prices of 20, 22-1/2 and 25 and initial expirations in April, May, August and November. Position limits of 4,500 contracts have been set.
For Plasma & Materials options, opening strike prices have been set at 10, 12-1/2 and 15, with expirations in April, May, June and September. Position limits of 4,500 contracts have been set.
Group One Ltd has been named specialist for the two options, the PHLX said.
At the PSE, options on PathoGenesis Corp are scheduled to begin trading on March 18, with opening strike prices of 30, 35 and 40, the exchange said.
Position limits of 7,500 contracts have been set, and initial expirations are set for April, May, June and September.
The options have been allocated to lead market makers Debbie Green and Alan Suslow, the PSE said.
